reviewText:
Call of Duty®: Black Ops II Multiplayer Total Hours: 2,759
Informal Review
Steam review by Jessica, en / C h x c `

I have played Call of Duty®: Black Ops II for the best part of 3 years and I have been active in each game in the franchise.

This game clearly represents the gaming style of the Call of Duty® franchise. Call Of Duty is an FPS which demands the use of your ears, eyes and mind. You must break situations down and make the correct judgements to execute effective movements. The game allows new people to have killing potential even when more experienced players are in the same lobby. This may be irritating to most but I feel like it gives a more equal tone to even the newest of players.

Gameplay:

Very rarely do you ever experience a lagging lobby unless your ping is 120+. Diamond Camo definitely adds an attractive challenge to the game if you wish to add some style and show off your skills to your opponents/team. Hitboxes are perfect. If you hit them you definitely hit them. I feel like most people think they miss because of the hitboxes, it is simply because the slight weapon sway which may be unnoticeable (this causes the bullet to go into a different direction than they expect). Overall, I feel like nothing in this game is completely outrageous; everything makes sense.

Recommendations:

Sniper Rifles - Ballista/DSR

Assault Rifles - AN-94/FAL-OSW/SCAR-H

Sub Machine Guns - MSMC/MP7/Peacekeeper (Revolution DLC weapon).

Pistols - Five-Seven/Tac-45

Shotguns - R870/KSG

Light Machine Guns - LSAT

Specials - Crossbow/Shield

Launchers - RPG/FHJ-18 AA

Lethal Grenades - Semtex/C4

Tactical Grenades - EMP/Concussion

Attachments - Adjustable Stock/FastMag/Long Barrel/Foregrip/Reflex Sight  (Fast Mag is recommended most for Snipers due to the disadvantage to SMG users and Assault Rifles).

Bugs:

Bug exploitation is definitely a thing. The reload-cancel for the shotgun gives a crazy level of unfair advantage but this is not a part of the game that was intentional, nor was the scroll-wheel pistol spray. These aspects are not often used but scripts for the shotgun and scripts for semi-automatic weapons definitely make things difficult. These aren't things which should be patched but they are definitely exploits to be aware of. I will remind you again that very few people use these.

Overall:

People often ask me why I don't play games such as Battlefield or Counterstrike, the answer is simple.

Picked this up at EB for $28, and in all honesty, I got my moneys worth. Although short, with less than 20 missions in all, I found it quite good and enjoyable. The price steam has it is NOT worth it at all, try and find a physical copy or buy it on console or something, it's probably better to get it on that costwise.

Campaign Mode:
I never played BO1 properly, I played it at a friends house on his ps3, and my experience was very biased, as I had never played a CoD game before, they instructed me to die constantly, killing the experience for me. After playing through BO2's campaign, I have found one of my favourite single player experiences. I enjoyed the storyline, and the characters were great. The bonus(?) levels where you took control of multiple troops was one of my favourite experiences, as it reminded me of some of my favourite games. Like I said, the storyline is rather short, but it is very enjoyable.


Zombies Mode:

After playing Zombies for a bit, I found it quite enjoyable. I found myself playing the doom soundtrack in the background. Zombies mode is your run of the mill horde based zombie defence. Unlock new areas inside your map to make life easier or harder. Fun game mode, and in my opinion, its a good game to play when bored or depressed. It's a good time waster, and the slow moving zombies, tied in with the fact they explode when on fire, is quite funny.

And Finally, Multiplayer:

Multiplayer has to be one of the most fun online FPS experiences I've had since I first started CS:GO or TF2. I've had the same enjoyment that I've had whilst playing games like Doom 1. It started off a little slow and rocky, with everyone else having great weapons compared to my pleb tier weapons. After I hit level 4, I unlocked custom loadouts, letting me use my personal favourite weapon. The multiple game modes make for a fun experience. The only thing I would prefer is a better sever joining system, such as the ones in valve games. BO2's multiplayer server system is more of a wheel of fortune, roll and hope you get a full game.

All in all, Black Ops 2 is one of my favourite games to date, and it is definatley worth a buy if you get it on sale

reviewText:
Call of Duty's first look into the future.

People tend to call Black Ops II the best Call of Duty game ever, and they also tend to say that in a pretty vocal way involving throwing offensive words in the direction of every other Call of Duty title. Well, I personally don't think this is the best game in the series, but it's not the worst one either. Quite far from that.

The campaign feels just like a Treyarch campaign from the very beginning so I'm sure you will like this one if you enjoyed the first Black Ops. Though I also have to say that to me, the story felt very slow and uninteresting for the first few missions and only started getting better and better towards the ending, where it luckily didn't disappoint and lived fully up to the Call of Duty name. Explosions, emotions, action.

Though it's not just your usual Call of Duty campaign. It's very obvious that they have tried to innovate, so apart from the story being separated into the futuristic setting of 2025 and the ending of the Cold War (in a way of flashbacks), there's also a brand new game mode, if that's a proper term for it. It's called Strike Force, seemingly involves more strategy as it's something along the lines of a real-time strategy, and it's a design nightmare and it sucks. There, I said it.

And because that wouldn't be enough to call it innovated, the campaign is pretty complex compared to the previous Call of Duty titles. Why is that? Well, there are multiple paths and endings, and the story actually changes around your actions, to a certain degree. It's not the best thing you'll ever see, but it was a pleasant surprise that the heavily advertised player choices weren't just A or B options in dialogues, but rather something that just happens in the background depending on what you do.

The multiplayer of Call of Duty: Black Ops II feels like a Call of Duty. I mean, yeah, really, what's there to say? There are guns and tons of game modes and scorestreaks and all that good stuff, though to me - apart from the great new system of class creation in which you can pretty much create any combination you desire - it felt like a downgrade from the first Black Ops game. I found it to be based less on skill and more on who knows the wall-banging spots better and can cooperate with their party to abuse the game to death, or your death, and your team's death because boo-hoo you just lost the match.

But yeah, it can be enjoyable, even more so if you play it with a group of friends. Hey, talking friends, I haven't mentioned the Zombies mode yet. It's obviously returning in this title, it has zombies and you shoot them for points and then exchange the points for weapons and the like. And it goes exactly like in every other title with the Zombies mode in - if you like cooperating in shooting zombie heads and have friends who like cooperating in shooting zombie heads, it can be fun.

Black Ops II was an average Call of Duty title to me - I'd pick Modern Warfare 3 over it any day, though.

reviewText:
This Game comes with 3 seperate shortcuts to start, Campaign aka Singleplayer, Multiplayer and Zombies, which is why I will focus on my review on each parts seperatly.

Singleplayer/Campaign:
The Singleplayer is a unique and upgraded experience which is adding to the Story of Black Ops 1. With amazing graphics gorgeous gameplay and lovely music.
This Time there is something new to the CoD Campaign which I never seen before. In some parts of the game, the game gives you the choice. Which means everybody will experience something different but it makes it also replayable to see what you missed out and what would off happened if you would off choosed something else, a little bit like the Tell Tale Games.
Another new thing which was new introduced into the Call of Duty Campaign Series was that before each Mission Starts you can choose your own class almost like you do it in Multiplayer, which makes the game more fun and leaves you more choices.

Multiplayer:
The Multiplayer is one of the best games that got released and is so far one of the last call of dutys that is still playable. The Settings have a native FOV Slider that goes up to 90 and also have Borderless Fullscreen Mode which is for me personally important with 2 screens. There is also a ping filter where you can decide to what kind of people you would like to connect for example would you rather play with 300 ping or with 30? Its up to you. Also this game is one of the only games that has dedicated servers.
There are 5 standard classes already unlocked and with each prestige you can get another one (up to 10 classes). With each Prestige comes also a permanent unlock tocken, which means if you prestige and your favourite weapon is for example going to be unlocked at level 50, you can permanently unlock it right away. Everytime you prestige your guns stay the same level, keep their cammos and attachments unlike Moderen Warfare 3 where you lose everything. Which makes it easier to get gold cammos or diamond cammos.
You can get diamond Cammo which is another first for the Call of Duty Series, if you want to get diamond guns you have to go through all the challenges for one class for example the smgs, once you got all gold, the diamond cammo will be unlocked. Those Challenges are alot of fun to do. So if you ever get bored of just brainlessly killing people or you like games where you can work towards something than you should try this out.

Zombies:
The Zombie Mode comes by default with 1 Map the Bus Depot you can buy more maps by purchasing the DLC or the Season Pass. The Zombie Mode itself is fair and has good graphics, sometimes it can be a bit glitchy but 99,9% of the time you won't find anything wrong with it. The Graphics are amazing and there is as well as in Number 1 always a hidden Song. You can complete the Bus Depot Map on your own or together with a friend (I recommend 2 people). The Story is really facinating and I hope it is going to continue in Number 3.
But you do not have to play the Story on Zombies, you also can play turned, where you fight as a zombie against your friends and Survival where you are just in one spot and can see how many rounds you will make it until the zombies finally got you.

For Achievement Hunters:
The Singleplayer should be easy to complete.
The Multiplayer is also easy to complete as long as you have a good team to play in the League Mode.
The Zombie Mode will require alot of work and is rather hard to do. Mostly you won't be able to do it on your own, so for some maps you will need up to 4 people with good communication possibilitys.

All in all, this game is wonderful. Yes I know there is a few cheaters in the multiplayer, but unlike other games you can record or even make pictures and send your proof + steam id of the cheater, to the actuall developers and they will ban the cheater.
See also my Guide:  Guide for how to report a Cheater

Due to the fact that this is one of the only games that have dedicated servers and Developers that still banning people it is playable and can be still alot of fun. Another important thing I forgot to say is, that it is very well optimised and I had no problems running it whatsoever on max graphics. It also supports 120fps screens. Personally this is my favourite Call of Duty so far.

Strike Force mode let's you control a squad, a robot and many assets to complete the mission, but if the player dies, then it recorded as loss and will affect how the story campaign goes. The Zombie mode are back also, with more feature and more weapons to use, and more zombies too.

Call of Duty: Black Ops II graphics are still not as advanced as Battlefield, but it'll do. After all, Call of Duty is not about graphics I think. But it's not that bad. The performances are also great, very smooth and making Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 performances like ♥♥♥♥.

Call of Duty: Black Ops is a good sequel, has real improvements to the Call of Duty series, it's worth it. I recommend this.

A few years ago in the town of Middlebury Oregon, there was a man named Joseph Woodstock. He liked to be called Joey. He was a nice fellow, with a few close friends. The local ladies who saw him sometimes bowling at the local Bowl-o-Rama Bowling Alley said he was pleasant on the eyes. He was a nice guy to be around, and a very pleasant conversationalist. He owned an auto parts store in town. the shop being one of only 2 auto places in town was profitable, leaving Joey to skip the 9 to 5 grind, and have plenty of free time to pursue more leisurly activities. Joey was American as apple pie, and loving life to the fullest. He did have a girlfriend, whom he had even asked to marry him recently. She gladly accepted. Joey's life seemed set.

Joey was a good wholesome average man, with lots to live for. Which is why none of the rest of this makes sense...

On the night of September 14th, 2012, Joey was last seen sitting outside of his 2 story home, on his steps. A neighbor recalls seeing Joey through her window across the street. Joey appeared to be shaking, wearing only what appeared to be a towel, shorts (possibly boxers), and no shoes on. He looked a mess. The neighbor went downstairs, and when she went out of her door to see if Joey was okay, he was gone. She went to his front door and rang the doorbell, but there was no answer.

2 days later, Joey's body was found outside of town washed up in a riverbed.

Police say there was no signs of foul play, and it appeared that he had commited suicide by jumping off a bridge located further upstream, breaking his neck on impact. None of this made sense. This man, whom was recently engaged and not in any trouble financially or otherwise, took his own life? This made no sense at all.

Police searched his home and found no evidence of foul play. When they searched his den, the lights were flickering off and on, with a faint humming coming from a computer fan. The computer had been left on. Maybe there were clues here? One officer walked up to the computer desk, and touched the mouse enough to get the computer out of sleep mode. what he saw haunted him. A few seconds later, the computer monitor sparked, and then it shut off. It had died. As well as the computer with it.

Haunted by what he had seen, officer Henry King mentioned none of this to other officers, and left what he had seen on the screen out of his report.

4 days later, Henry King was found dead in his apartment. He had hung himself the night before.

reviewText:
Reviews for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing
---

With regard to accessibility for deaf/hoh gamers, I give Black Ops 2 8/10 single player and 6/10 multiplayer.

Gameplay
I am an avid FPS gamer.  Like any FPS, you will get killed by things you did not know were coming.  Even the most well-captioned FPS game will have uncaptioned audio cues for imminent danger.  That said, Black Ops 2 does okay in this category, but doesn't break the mold.

Subtitles/Text
Subtitles for single player are just subtitles - no captions - but they help tell the story.  I do feel that they are a little slow, though, for key moments when you have to react quickly.  For multiplayer, there are no captions or subtitles.  You are on your own.

Chatting/Communicating
BO2 allows text chat, but most players make use of voice chat in my experience.  In the lobby, you can ONLY use voice chat - there is no input for text there.

reviewText:
W.I.P Review - (Work In Progress)

Firstly since Black Ops 2 comes as 3 separate games on your Steam Games List when you buy it (Black Ops 2 - Campaign, Black Ops 2 Multiplayer & Black Ops 2 Zombies) i will be reviewing them all here split into thier own sections to make it easier to see which part of the game i will be reviewing.

Black Ops 2 - Campaign

The campaign to this game is really good in my opinion, i have thoroughly enjoyed pretty much every mission.  The story line is not too bad and links in with previous story lines from Treyarcs CoD games.  The graphics i run at maximun are not too bad either but there are parts of various missions in which there are most certainly texture issues or misplaced objects which you can see in my steam screenshots for this game.

The campaign is as with every other CoD just as explosive and violent with so much variety in the scenery or vehicles you can use etc.  One thing i do like in this campaign is being able to use an Access Kit during every mission, which allows access to various perks such as Drones, ASD's or CLAW's (Military Automated Units) and also things like Flak Jackets for reduced explosive damage and alternative Melee weapons.  Some parts are as with previous CoD's overly excessive with violence but it doesnt make the game any less fun in my opinion.

Also as with many previous CoD games there are Intel's to collect in each mission, however something i liked in this game is that there are two versions of Intel - One for missions based in the Past, and one version for the missions based in the Future. There are also Challenges for each mission which if completed allow access to more perks and more powerful weapons to use in the missions ahead or previous missions if you use the Replay Mission feature (after completing story).

The last feature i do like in this game was the ability to choose your weapons setup before starting a mission. You are able to choose both a primary and secondary weapon of your choosing with up to 3 attachments too.  Then you can also choose your grenades and perks too. Some grenades, weapons or perks are required to do the challenges in the game but sometimes those particular missions would also have the required weapon laying around nearby. Also challenges are not necessary to complete so its not super important if you dont take any particular weapon, grenade or perk.

Achievements - Achievements are also separate for each part of this game, the Achievements for the campaign part are all pretty straightforward, the most difficult being to complete every single challenge in every single mission including the StrikeForce missions.

Cons

The bad points i have picked up on having played this game are as follows:

- Lag

For some unknown reason at some point in pretty much every single mission i had huge lag spikes where my FPS (Frames Per Second) would drop to like 2 FPS.  I have an absoloute beast of a computer and could run max graphics 100% of the time with no issues but these random lag spikes hit for like upto around 15 seconds where i can barely turn or anything because its going so slow.  Its not based on internet in this case as its purely singleplayer even if you disconnect internet and play its the same issue.  Fortunately this only happens about once on every map for no more than 15 seconds and may have not happened at all some times.  The only reason i say every mission is because i have played through each mission multiple times to get every challenge complete for the achievements.

- Cinematics

This game has ALOT of cinematics, and they are very good and work well alongside the missions and quite often during the missions.  Therefore i have absoloutly no issue with the cinematics at all and this should not put the average player off at all.  However, if you are attempting to do EVERY SINGLE CHALLENGE in order to get EVERY SINGLE ACHIEVEMENT, you have to play through each mission multiple times and it takes a very long time watching the cinematics over and over again.  Some you can skip fairly quickly, sometimes you have to watch for like 30 seconds before it can be skipped and you can start the mission.  But the in-game cinematics 9 times out of 10 cant be skipped and takes forever to just continue with the mission to get your challenges or whatever.

Would be very nice to just have instantly skippable cinematics when using the Replay Mission feature after having completed the story at least once. Watching the same cinematic however many times it takes you to do some of the challenges is just not fun :P

- A.I. / StrikeForce Challenges

The A.I. (Artificial Intelligence) units for this game are not too bad for the main campaign, you probably wont have a problem with them. However the A.I. in the StrikeForce Missions are absoloutly terrible and make them almost unplayable. I have completed all 5 StrikeForce missions in the Tactical View only for the Challenge required for the Achievement, and occasionally the A.I. just dont move ever, they get stuck and they stand until they die.  Having said that, the StrikeForce missions i have done in Tactical View were pretty straightforward and i did the challenge first time.

The mission 'Shpwrecked' even on Recruit difficulty seems to be impossible to do due to A.I. not doing anything at all, or dying almost instantly to enemy soldiers or ASD's. They don't attack enemies en route to waypoints, they just run straight past them, so they die.  You do seem to have to really work to get them to kill things and defend properly in this one mission.

I have completed this mission with very little difficulty having finally gotten around to it, at the time i completed it, i had quite a large force of soldiers, ASD's and a claw all fairly close to each other so they seemed to protect each other from dying so easily.  Once the Tactical View Challenge is done for all StrikeForce missions the rest of the challenges are a breeze.

One thing i will note to help others in completing challenges is that you do NOT need to successfully complete the mission so you can spend as long as you like 'running over soldiers with an ASD' for example until time runs out and you fail the mission if thats what it takes.



Black Ops 2 - Multiplayer

Haven't really played this enough to review just yet - W.I.P

Achievements - There are only 5 achievements for this part of the game, they appear to be very straightforward and one should not have a problem getting all of the achievements with probably less than 30 hours played. Assuming you physically try to get them as you do have to play in certain playlists to get 3 of them.  The other two being reach level 10 and reaching Prestige for the 1st time.



Black Ops 2 - Zombies

Haven't really played this enough to review just yet - W.I.P

Achievements - The Achievements for this part of the game if you want all of them DO REQUIRE ALL DLC, otherwise you can only get about 1/4 of them. I personally have not really played the zombies mode much but having being part of the zombies community and having seen alot of Livestreams of these base maps and DLC maps i would probably recommend the DLC if you enjoy the zombies mode.

I got the game on Steam Sales, believe me, if the price didn't drop I don't think I'd ever even think of buying it, and I suggest you shouldn't too.
Now, about the game.
It's very fun, Call of Duty is not meant to be taken seriously, it's a game you just go in and kill other people, just for the fun of it, at least that's what kind of experience I gain from it when I play. *Note this part was meant to talk about online.*
Now, for the single player part.
I'd suggest you try the other COD games as well, perhaps playing and finishing the original Black Ops will give you a bit of a more clear view of what's going on.
It has some very epic moments, like, for example, a HUGE fight with machetes and guns and limbs falling around (Yes, the game has gore in the campaign too if you'd like to know, even though it's single player ONLY (and zombies mode))
Now, if you're thinking of buying Black Ops 2, the game comes with the zombie mode for free, so let's also talk about that.
Zombie mode is a very old feature which I believe started from COD 4 or WaW, which many people loved, and still do, in case you are not familiar with it.
It's a very fun mode to play with friends, and it's the only way not to get bored of it. It includes only 3-4 maps originally, while the rest of them are DLCs, even though those 3-4 are pretty damn big, especially the bus one!! :P
As I said, zombies are dismemberable and also feature lots of gore, but as the rounds increase, zombies get tougher, and tougher, until it's just impossible to hold back.

reviewText:
I've always hated the Call of Duty series for a long time only because I didn't like the fanbase. After seeing many videos and reviews of this game, I decided to get it.

If you're thinking of buying Ghosts you may want to re-consider that. Black Ops II is a much better game.

The game is split up into 3 sections. Campaign, Multiplayer, and Zombies all with seperate launchers.

Campaign:
The Campaign doesn't really follow Black Ops's Story. The only comparisons of Black Ops and Black Ops II are the characters. The game is taken place in 2025 unlike in the 1960s like Black Ops. You must stop Raul Menendez from taking over the world in this futuristic type of gameplay.

Campaign Grade: 9/10

Multiplayer:
This has to be the best Multiplayer yet in a Call of Duty game.The guns are absolutely awesome, the maps are great, Nuketown from Black Ops returns, and the scorestreaks are great. If you wanted the M.O.A.B. from MW3 you may be disappointed. The M.O.A.B. is not in this game however that doesn't ruin the challenge of this game at all. The DLC is also great for this game too. Wager Matches return from Black Ops as Party Games. No more COD points needed to unlock guns. Just level up and get new guns. Everytime you prestige you unlock a Prestige Token. These allow you to unlock ANYTHING at anytime of the game. These Prestige Tokens can be used for unlocking guns at lower levels, unlocking perks at lower levels, or getting extra class slots. It's a great reward for prestiging wich is really good. Although some of the spawns are bad on some maps and there may not be as many people playing like there was before, Black Ops II multiplayer is such a fun experience.

Multiplayer Grade: 9.8/10

Zombies:
Zombies may have to be the weakest part of the game unless you have the DLC. There's onlt 3 small survival maps. But there is two new very unique gamemodes to the Zombies experience. The gamemodes are TranZit and Grief. TranZit isn't really a Story Mode but more of like an Adventure mode. Finding parts to build shields and tools make TranZit awesome. You're not on a bus the whole time don't worry. You still have to run around and survive as long as you can. Grief mode is where two teams battle it out to survive. Basically saying, only one team survives. The DLC for Zombies is what makes it good. Getting the Season Pass is definitely worth getting if you want the best Zombie experience possible.

Zombie Grade: 8/10

Overall Black Ops II is such a great game you don't want to miss out on. If the game ever goes on sale BUY IT.

OVERALL RATING 9/10

reviewText:
I have been a Call of Duty fan since Infinity ward's Call of Duty 1 and United Offensive, and Black Ops 2 shows Treyarch's extreme Capabilty of making amazing games across all platforms. Black Ops 2 is in my opinion the BEST Call of Duty to date. Treyarch stepped away from the usual Call of Duty formula and set out to try many new approaches in this game and in my opinion have successfully made each approach awesome.

The new engine that Black Ops 2 runs on is just Gorgeous!!!The overall graphical fidelity and the colour pallet are so beautiful. It's the best graphical experience in CoD history. The capability of the game running so well on lower end graphics cards just amazes me.

The fact that you change between 2025 and the Cold War in the campaign gives you such an amazing blend of old and new and makes you feel like you are in Black Ops 1 for some moments. The Campaign has lets u make vital choices which change the course of the game. There are 6 different endings, a first for the Call of Duty franchise.

The Zombie mode is the best it's ever been, especially with the dynamic map Tranzit. The concept of having to complete objectives in Zombies is just spectacular as it complicates the gameplay positively and allows you to think about about which player should do whuch objective.

The Multiplayer is THE BEST Call of Duty Multiplayer experience you can have! A wide variety of amazing weapons and gadgets, Beautiful and well designed maps (including a modern remake of Nuketown) and ease of use match joining system is fantastic! I can click find game - TeamDeathmatch and within seconds I'm in a local game with a very low ping.
